intro: Rapanea jaliscensis, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen or Jalisco evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Mexican states of Jalisco and Nayarit, where it grows in humid montane forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible drupes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
